title: Recent visit to used/old book store
content:
Hi all!  
I recently made a visit to a used/old book store. By the way, we have a word in portuguese for these special stores, that sell old and used books: alfarrabista. Does English have a special word for this?Other them second-hand bookseller or antiquarian?

I found some old pages from a catalogue with some typefaces and ornaments. I made a digitalisation of some to share with the “commutity”...  
Enjoy

António Fonseca

PS- As soon as I get more free time I will digitalise the rest...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [alfarrabista1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203211630/http:/typophile.com/files/alfarrabista1.jpg) | 406.44 KB |

author: afonseca1974

comments.content: Most people just say used book store.

Like promissed [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203211630/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/23497430@N08/) is the rest of the digitalisation...  
Enjoy...

I also made a visit to Museu Nacional da Imprensa (porto, Portugal)and posted some pictures there.

António Fonseca
